anns.postfix: N-terminal amino acid, carbamoylpolyoxamic acid36 (CPOAA, 18), and is thought to function as a protecting group.

anns.postfix: biosynthesis is unique since phosphorylation is introduced early in the pathway, retained for the pathway’s duration, and has no apparent chemical role.

anns.prefix: We searched for the characterized biosynthetic intermediates in the culture media of the gene disruptants, and observed accumulation of 5’-OAP (~0.25 mg/mL isolated yield) and OABP (~0.03 mg/mL, LCMS quantitation) in ΔnikL::
anns.postfix: , and 2’-OAP (~0.2 mg/mL isolated yield) and KOAP (~0.1 mg/mL isolated yield) in ΔnikK::kanR mutants (Figure 5c).

anns.prefix: LCMS analysis also revealed that the ΔnikK::
anns.postfix: strain accumulated trace amounts of HKOAP (~0.01 mg/mL, LCMS quantitation, Figure 5e), which is consistent with the in vitro function of NikK (Figure 5a).

anns.postfix: deletion, markerless in-frame deletion was performed.

anns.postfix: (5’-polQ2) was amplified with primers KA16F and KA16R (Supplementary Table 4) to generate a 1,294 bp DNA fragment with terminal EcoRI and NdeI sites.

anns.postfix: (3’-polQ2) was amplified with primers KA17F1 and KA17R1 to generate a 1,431 bp DNA fragment with terminal NdeI and HindIII sites.

anns.postfix: and pJET/3’-polQ2, at their restriction sites described above, and subcloned into pKC1139 digested with EcoRI and HindIII to create pKC1139/ΔpolQ2.

anns.prefix: After sequence confirmation using pJET universal primers, the pJET1.2-
anns.postfix: was digested with NdeI and HindIII and the nikK fragment was subcloned into the NdeI and HindIII site of pIJ10257 53 to yield pIJ10257/nikK. The NdeI and HindIII site is downstream of the constitutive ermE* promoter, allowing constitutive expression of nikK. Intergeneric conjugation of E. coli ET12567/pUZ8002 carrying the pIJ10257/nikK with S. tendae ΔnikK::kanR was carried out as described above using the spore suspension that was heat shocked at 37°C for 30 min instead .
